p: The findings of mineral analysis showed that the studied plants were higher in oligo-elements, especially calcium, potassium, magnesium, iron, and phosphorus. Therefore, these results can justify the use of these plants as food supplements [ 11, 15, 18, 24, 48]. The results of the mineral analysis of different parts (leaves, capitula, roots, and seeds) of the two varieties are presented in Table 3. The findings obtained showed that calcium was predominant in leaves over the other elements detected (Bi, Cu, Fe, K, Mg, Mn, Na, P, Se, and Zn) while seeds had high levels of copper and iron. Particularly, leaves of A. P var. pyrethrum were higher in phosphorus content. Therefore, the two studied varieties were found to be different in terms of mineral concentrations.
